conflictDescription: The developer story wants ALFRED to enforce consent policies automatically with minimal user prompts, which may imply some automatic listening or processing. The older adult story wants ALFRED to listen only after the talk button is pressed, to avoid unwanted listening. These goals partly conflict because automatic enforcement might require ALFRED to listen or act without explicit button press, which the older adult wants to prevent.
conflictingNfrPairs: Automatically enforce user consent policies with minimal prompts
ALFRED listens only after the talk button is pressed
Automatically enforce user consent policies with minimal prompts
ALFRED does not respond to voice commands without button press
userStoryASummary: As a developer, I want ALFRED to enforce consent policies automatically with minimal user prompts and allow caregiver overrides, so the system stays secure and user-friendly.
userStoryBSummary: As an older adult, I want ALFRED to respond only when I press the talk button, so I control when it listens and feel safe from unwanted use.
